intro: Razoumofskya, commonly known as the "flower of the sea," is a genus of flowering plants native to the coastal regions of southern Africa. These plants are characterized by their succulent, fleshy leaves and showy, often brightly colored flowers that bloom in spring. They are adapted to saline and arid environments, making them resilient to coastal conditions. The genus includes several species, such as Razoumofskya capensis and Razoumofskya kirstenboschii, which are prized for their ornamental value. Their unique appearance and ability to thrive in challenging environments make them popular among succulent enthusiasts.
